selected_quotes: So we're destroying grasslands and draining the Ogallala for a fuel with a dubious carbon benefit? I call B.S.
This is BIG: Recent grassland losses are concentrated around U.S. ethanol refineries @IOPenvironment…
Grasslands are spaces of important biodiversity. Now agrofuels/ corn #ethanol are wiping out vast swathes to fuel your car. #N…
What many believed was true.Recent grassland losses are concentrated around U.S. ethanol refineries
Had seen some of preliminary research and direct links to biofuels seemed possible, but this confirms suspicions

citation.title: Recent grassland losses are concentrated around U.S. ethanol refineries

news.title: Habitat loss highest near ethanol plants
news.summary: Millions of acres of wildlife habitat have been lost to corn production across America's heartland in recent years and the damage is worst nearest ethanol production plants.

news.title: Environmental impact overlooked as ethanol production drives grassland loss
news.summary: More than three million acres of grassland around ethanol refineries in the USA was lost to crop production between 2008 and 2012 as the USA sought to increase biofuel production, according to a new study.

news.title: We already knew the ethanol mandate was bad for the environment. New study finds it is destroying wildlife habitats.
news.summary: Federal and state governments, through subsidies and mandates, push the agriculture and energy industries to grow corn for burning in car engines, and this has many political, economic and environmental downsides.
